properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Max
properties.help: Maximum number of nodes.

properties.name: Min
properties.help: Minimum number of nodes.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location in which to create the cluster. If the location is not specified and default location is not configured, will default to the resource group's location.

properties.name: GenerateSshKeys
properties.help: Generate SSH public and private key files if missing. The keys will be stored in the ~/.ssh directory.

properties.name: Password
properties.help: Password.

properties.name: SshKey
properties.help: SSH public key value or path. If the value is not provided and no ssh public key or password is configured in the config file the default public ssh key (~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub) of the current user will be used (if available).

properties.name: UserName
properties.help: Name of the admin user account to be created on each compute node. If the value is not provided and no user configuration is provided in the config file, current user's name will be used.

properties.name: Config
properties.help: A path to a json file containing cluster create parameters (json representation of azure.mgmt.batchai.models.ClusterCreateParameters).

properties.name: UseAutoStorage
properties.help: If provided, the command will create a storage account in a new or existing resource group named "batchaiautostorage". It will also create Azure File Share with name "batchaishare", Azure Blob Container with name "batchaicontainer". The File Share and Blob Container will be mounted on each cluster node at $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/autoafs and $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/autobfs. If the resource group already exists and contains an approapriate storage account belonging to the same region as cluster, this command will reuse existing storage account.

properties.name: AfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for Azure File share. The file share will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: AfsName
properties.help: Name of the Azure File Share to be mounted on each cluster node. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name and --storage-account-key arguments or AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_ACCOUNT and AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_KEY environment variables. If you need to mount more than one Azure File Share, configure them in a configuration file and use --config option.

properties.name: BfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for Azure Storage container. The container will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: BfsName
properties.help: Name of Azure Storage container to be mounted on each cluster node. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name and --storage-account-key arguments or AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_ACCOUNT and AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_KEY environment variables. If you need to mount more than one Azure Storage Blob Container, configure them in a configuration file and use --config option.

properties.name: Nfs
properties.help: Name of a file server to mount on each cluster node. If you need to mount more than one file server, configure them in a configuration file and use --config option.

properties.name: NfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for NFS. The NFS will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: NfsResourceGroup
properties.help: Resource group in which file server is created. Can be omitted if the file server and the cluster belong to the same resource group.

properties.name: CustomImage
properties.help: Resource id of a virtual machine image to be used for nodes creation. Note, you need to provide --image with which this image was created.

properties.name: Image
properties.help: Operation system image for cluster nodes. The value may contain an alias (UbuntuDSVM, UbuntuLTS) or specify image details in the form "publisher:offer:sku:version". If image configuration is not provided via command line or configuration file, Batch AI will choose default OS image.

properties.name: Max
properties.help: Max nodes count for the auto-scale cluster.

properties.name: Min
properties.help: Min nodes count for the auto-scale cluster.

properties.name: Target
properties.help: Number of nodes which should be allocated immediately after cluster creation. If the cluster is in auto-scale mode, BatchAI can change the number of nodes later based on number of running and queued jobs.

properties.name: VmPriority
properties.help: VM priority. If lowpriority selected the node can get preempted while the job is running.

properties.name: VmSize
properties.help: VM size for cluster nodes (e.g. Standard_NC6 for 1 GPU node).

properties.name: SetupTask
properties.help: A command line which should be executed on each compute node when it's got allocated or rebooted. The task is executed under a user account added into sudoers list (so, it can use sudo). Note, if this parameter is specified, it will overwrite setup task given in the configuration file.

properties.name: SetupTaskOutput
properties.help: Location of the folder where setup-task's logs will be stored. Required if setup-task argument is provided. Note, Batch AI will create create several helper folders under this location. The created folders are reported as stdOutErrPathSuffix by get cluster command.

properties.name: StorageAccountKey
properties.help: Storage account key. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name. Environment variable: AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_KEY. Optional if the storage account belongs to the current subscription.

properties.name: StorageAccountName
properties.help: Storage account name for Azure File Shares and/or Azure Storage Containers to be mounted on each cluster node. Related environment variable: AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_ACCOUNT. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-key. If the key is not provided, the command will try to query the storage account key using the authenticated Azure account.

properties.name: Subnet
properties.help: Resource id of a virtual network subnet to put the cluster in.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Do not prompt for confirmation.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Expiry
properties.help: Time in minutes for how long generated download URLs should remain valid.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: Relative path of a subfolder inside of node setup task output directory.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Target
properties.help: Target number of compute nodes.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the file server.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location in which to create the file server. If default location is not configured, will default to the resource group's location.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: VmSize
properties.help: VM size.

properties.name: GenerateSshKeys
properties.help: Generate SSH public and private key files if missing. The keys will be stored in the ~/.ssh directory.

properties.name: Password
properties.help: Password.

properties.name: SshKey
properties.help: SSH public key value or path. If the value is not provided and no ssh public key or password is configured in the config file the default public ssh key (~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub) of the current user will be used (if available).

properties.name: UserName
properties.help: Name of the admin user account to be created on NFS node. If the value is not provided and no user configuration is provided in the config file, current user's name will be used.

properties.name: Config
properties.help: A path to a json file containing file server create parameters (json representation of azure.mgmt.batchai.models.FileServerCreateParameters). Note, parameters given via command line will overwrite parameters specified in the configuration file.

properties.name: CachingType
properties.help: Caching type for premium disks. If not provided via command line or in configuration file, no caching will be used.

properties.name: DiskCount
properties.help: Number of disks.

properties.name: DiskSize
properties.help: Disk size in Gb.

properties.name: StorageSku
properties.help: The sku of storage account to persist VM.

properties.name: Subnet
properties.help: Resource id of a virtual network subnet to put the file server in. If not provided via command line or in configuration file, Batch AI will create a new virtual network and subnet under your subscription.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the file server.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Do not prompt for confirmation.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the file server.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Config
properties.help: A path to a json file containing job create parameters (json representation of azure.mgmt.batchai.models.JobCreateParameters).

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the job.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ClusterName
properties.help: If specified, the job will run on the given cluster instead of the one configured in the json file.

properties.name: ClusterResourceGroup
properties.help: Specifies a resource group for the cluster given with --cluster-name parameter. If omitted, --resource-group value will be used.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location in which to create the job. If default location is not configured, will default to the resource group's location.

properties.name: AfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for Azure File Share. The File Share will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_JOB_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: AfsName
properties.help: Name of the Azure File Share to mount during the job execution. The File Share will be mounted only on the nodes which are executing the job. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name and --storage-account-key arguments or AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_ACCOUNT and AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_KEY environment variables. If you need to mount more than one Azure File share, configure them in a configuration file and use --config option.

properties.name: BfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for Azure Storage Blob Container. The container will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_JOB_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: BfsName
properties.help: Name of Azure Storage Blob Container to mount during the job execution. The container will be mounted only on the nodes which are executing the job. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name and --storage-account-key arguments or AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_ACCOUNT and AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_KEY environment variables. If you need to mount more than one Azure Storage container, configure them in a configuration file and use --config option.

properties.name: NfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for NFS. The NFS will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_JOB_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: NfsName
properties.help: Name of a file server to mount during the job execution. The NFS will be mounted only on the nodes which are executing the job. If you need to mount more than one file server, configure them in a configuration file and use --config option.

properties.name: NfsResourceGroup
properties.help: Resource group in which file server is created. Can be omitted if the file server and the job belong to the same resource group.

properties.name: StorageAccountKey
properties.help: Storage account key. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name. Environment variable: AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_KEY.

properties.name: StorageAccountName
properties.help: Storage account name for Azure File Shares and/or Azure Storage Containers to be mounted. Related environment variable: AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_ACCOUNT. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-key. If the key is not provided, the command will try to query the storage account key using the authenticated Azure account.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the job.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Yes

properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: NoWait

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Interval
properties.help: Polling interval in sec.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the job.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Expiry
properties.help: Time in minutes for how long generated download URL should remain valid.

properties.name: OutputDirectoryId
properties.help: The Id of the job's output directory (as specified by "id" element in outputDirectories collection in the job create parameters).

properties.name: Path
properties.help: Relative path in the given output directory.

properties.name: FileName
properties.help: The name of the file to stream.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the job.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: OutputDirectoryId
properties.help: The Id of the job's output directory (as specified by "id" element in outputDirectories collection in the job create parameters).

properties.name: Path
properties.help: Relative path in the given output directory.

commonTaskProperties.name: Debug
commonTaskProperties.help: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

commonTaskProperties.name: Help
commonTaskProperties.help: Show this help message and exit.

commonTaskProperties.name: Query
commonTaskProperties.help: JMESPath query string. See <a href="http://jmespath.org/">http://jmespath.org/</a> for more information and examples.

commonTaskProperties.name: Verbose
commonTaskProperties.help: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.
